original_solution_mapping.L1: There will be $1000 x 3/10 = $<<1000*3/10=300>>300 worth of money that will be changed into $50 bills.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Uncle Bradley will have $300/$50 = <<300/50=6>>6 pieces of $50 bills.
original_solution_mapping.L3: He will change $1000 - $300 = $<<1000-300=700>>700 worth of money into $100 bills.
original_solution_mapping.L4: So there will be $700/$100 = <<700/100=7>>7 pieces of $100 bills.
original_solution_mapping.L5: Thus, there will be a total of 6 + 7 = <<6+7=13>>13 pieces of $50 and $100 bills in all.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4500.
    Returns: the total number of pieces of bills Uncle Bradley will have.
    """
    # L1
    total_money = 1000 # a $1000 bill
    fraction_for_50_bills = Fraction(3, 10) # 3/10 of the money
    money_for_50_bills = total_money * fraction_for_50_bills

    # L2
    fifty_dollar_bill_value = 50 # $50 bills
    num_50_dollar_bills = money_for_50_bills / fifty_dollar_bill_value

    # L3
    money_for_100_bills = total_money - money_for_50_bills

    # L4
    hundred_dollar_bill_value = 100 # $100 bills
    num_100_dollar_bills = money_for_100_bills / hundred_dollar_bill_value

    # L5
    total_pieces_of_bills = num_50_dollar_bills + num_100_dollar_bills

    # FA
    answer = total_pieces_of_bills
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There will be ${total_money} x {fraction_for_50_bills} = $<<{total_money}*{fraction_for_50_bills}={money_for_50_bills}>>{money_for_50_bills} worth of money that will be changed into $50 bills.
Uncle Bradley will have ${money_for_50_bills}/${fifty_dollar_bill_value} = <<{money_for_50_bills}/{fifty_dollar_bill_value}={num_50_dollar_bills}>>{num_50_dollar_bills} pieces of $50 bills.
He will change ${total_money} - ${money_for_50_bills} = $<<{total_money}-{money_for_50_bills}={money_for_100_bills}>>{money_for_100_bills} worth of money into $100 bills.
So there will be ${money_for_100_bills}/${hundred_dollar_bill_value} = <<{money_for_100_bills}/{hundred_dollar_bill_value}={num_100_dollar_bills}>>{num_100_dollar_bills} pieces of $100 bills.

Thus, there will be a total of {num_50_dollar_bills} + {num_100_dollar_bills} = <<{num_50_dollar_bills}+{num_100_dollar_bills}={total_pieces_of_bills}>>{total_pieces_of_bills} pieces of $50 and $100 bills in all.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: There will be $1000 x 3/10 = $<<1000*3/10=300>>300 worth of money that will be changed into $50 bills.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Uncle Bradley will have $300/$50 = <<300/50=6>>6 pieces of $50 bills.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: He will change $1000 - $300 = $<<1000-300=1300>>1300 worth of money into $100 bills.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: So there will be $1300/$100 = <<1300/100=13>>13 pieces of $100 bills.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: Thus, there will be a total of 6 + 13 = <<6+13=19>>19 pieces of $50 and $100 bills in all.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '+' instead.
